citation.article-title: Methanoculleus hydrogenitrophicus sp. nov., a methanogenic archaeon isolated from wetland soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methanoculleus hydrogenitrophicus sp. nov.

Methanoculleus hydrogenitrophicus [hy.dro.ge.ni.tro′phi.cus. N.L. n. hydrogenum hydrogen (from Gr. n. hudôr water; Gr. v. gennaô to produce); N.L. masc. adj. trophicus nursing, tending or feeding (from Gr. adj. trophikos); N.L. masc. adj. hydrogenitrophicus using hydrogen as electron donor].
Cells are non-motile, Gram-negative-staining, irregular coccoids.
Produces methane only from H2 and CO2.
Acetate is not required for growth; yeast extract stimulates growth.
Growth occurs at 18–45 °C with optimum growth around 37 °C.
The pH range is 5.0–8.5, with optimum growth around pH 6.6.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.2 mol%.
The type strain, HCT (=CGMCC 1.5146T =JCM 16311T), was isolated from the Zoige wetland, China.
